messages.title: WE CAN'T GO ON LIKE THIS. IT'S TIME FOR CHANGE.
messages.content: The general election is just weeks away now. This is a big moment for Britain. It comes at a time when our economy is in deep trouble, we need to mend our broken society and rebuild trust in our political system. We can't go on like this. Britain needs change to get the country back on its feet - to head the mistakes of the past and bring new ideas and energy for our future.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will cut the deficit not the NHS, deliver a dynamic and open economy.
We will act on the gross abuses of power and bring transparency to Parliament.
We will protect spending on the NHS and improve it for everyone.
We will stand up for families, sort out our schools and fight back against crime.
I will continue the battle against Heathrow expansion. A Conservative Government will scrap Labour's third runway.
Better District Line and South West Train services. Getting extra capacity and better station facilities is vital for local commuters.
Safer streets. I will press for the police we need to cut assaults and protect our families.
Roehampton Regeneration. Creating more local jobs and better facilities for local people in Roehampton to be self-sufficient.

mentions.candidate: I have been a privilege to be our MP since 2005, representing our community. I have worked hard in Parliament and locally on the issues.

issues.economy: We will cut the deficit not the NHS, deliver a dynamic and open economy.
issues.education: We will stand up for families, sort out our schools and fight back against crime.
issues.governance: We will act on the gross abuses of power and bring transparency to Parliament.
issues.health: We will protect spending on the NHS and improve it for everyone.
issues.socialWelfare: We will stand up for families, sort out our schools and fight back against crime.

leaflet.personalStatement: I live in West Hill and it has been a privilege to be our MP since 2005, representing our community.

politicalExperience.achievements: I have worked hard in Parliament and locally on the issues.

contactInformation.address: Putney, Roehampton & Southfields Conservatives, 3 Summerstown, London SW17 0BQ

leaflet.additionalNotes: Across Putney; Roehampton & Southfields I have worked on a range of issues, from supporting our local businesses during the recession and campaigning to keep Richmond Park free from car park charges, to making sure Southfields Station gets a passenger lift and having better Dial-a-Ride services.
